data.scheme_name: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Udhyog Uday Yojana for SC/ST Entrepreneurs for MSME - Assistance to MSME Manufacturing sector participation in the Exhibition (National and International) - SC/ST - Existing
data.benefits: To encourage MSMEs to participate in national/international exhibitions, this scheme provides reimbursement from Rs 0.5 - 5 lakhs.
data.eligibility: SC/ST Entrepreneurs for MSME enterprises of manufacturing sector participating in Exhibition/ Trade fairs in India or International
data.conditions:
1. The enterprise that has received assistance under this scheme will not be entitled to avail benefit of any other Government scheme for the same component/purpose, unless specifically specified under that scheme
  2. MSME may avail benefits of Government of India Scheme for such components for which assistance is not availed under Government of Gujarat Scheme or Vice Versa
  3. The total quantum of assistance under both State and Central Government Scheme would be limited to actual expenditure
  4. International level exhibition must be approved by MSME Development Institute (MSME-DI), India Trade Promotion Organization (ITPO), EEPC India, Federation of Indian Export Organization (FIEO), etc., or state government will be eligible under the scheme.
data.beneficiaries:
1. Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises of manufacturing sector participating in Exhibitions/Trade fairs organized in India or International Exhibition/Trade fairs organized outside India or inside India will be eligible
  2. Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises participating in Exhibitions/Trade fairs should be in production in the State of Gujarat during the operative period of the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The enterprise that has received assistance under this scheme will not be entitled to avail benefit of any other Government scheme for the same component/purpose, unless specifically specified under that scheme
  2. MSME may avail benefits of Government of India Scheme for such components for which assistance is not availed under Government of Gujarat Scheme or Vice Versa
  3. The total quantum of assistance under both State and Central Government Scheme would be limited to actual expenditure
  4. International level exhibition must be approved by MSME Development Institute (MSME-DI), India Trade Promotion Organization (ITPO), EEPC India, Federation of Indian Export Organization (FIEO), etc., or state government will be eligible under the scheme.
data.context:
• The Industrial Policy 2020 envisions Gujarat as a global business destination for next-generation sustainable manufacturing and service industry that stimulates sustainable development, inclusive and a balanced regional growth. 
  • The primary mission of the Industrial Policy includes support for development of MSMEs, focus on Export Competitiveness : Vocal for Local to become Global and thus strengthen integrated value chains across product segments.
data.objective: To encourage MSMEs to participate in various levels of exhibitions
data.description:
• Amount or percentage of subsidy: State Level Exhibition: Assistance @ 80% maximum up to Rs.50,000/ (Cost of stall rent +cost for product literature and display material cost. Enterprise will be entitled for maximum 5 times during operative period of the scheme. National level exhibition: Assistance @ 80% maximum up to Rs.1 lakh/ (Cost of stall rent +cost for product literature and display material cost.
  •  Enterprise will be entitled for maximum 5 times during operative period of the scheme International level exhibition (Inside India) Assistance @ 80% maximum up to Rs.2 lakh/ (Cost of stall rent +cost for product literature and display material cost. Enterprise will be entitled for maximum 5 times during operative period of the scheme International level exhibition (outside India) Assistance @ 70% maximum up to Rs.5 lakh/ (Cost of stall rent +cost for product literature and display material cost.
  •  Enterprise will be entitled for maximum 3 times during operative period of the scheme Maximum cap of product literature and display material is capped at Rs.50,000/= The assistance will be provided by way of reimbursement.
data.how_to_apply: MSME unit can apply online at IFP portal to District industries Centres within six months from the last date of exhibition/trade fair in which it has participated
data.funding_facilitator: Industries and Mines Department, Government of Gujarat
data.funding_mechanism: The assistance will be release after the training session.
data.additional_info: The enterprise that has availed assistance under this component cannot avail assistance under any other scheme of other department of state government for the same component providing similar benefit. However, Enterprise can avail under such schemes of Government of India, if any.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Copy of Udyam Registration (if applicable) 
2. Copy of the Constitution of the enterprise (MOA or AOA) 
3. Copy of PAN Card of Enterprise 
4. Copy of PAN Card of Applicant/Promoters/Directors/partners and authorised signatory 
5. CA certificate for fixed capital investment 
6. Copy of Gujarat Pollution Control Board approved NOC/Consent & other departments approval (if applicable) 
7. Copy of GST Registration (if applicable) 
8. Copy of GST return of previous financial year (if applicable) 
9. Copy of ITR of the last financial year (if applicable) 
10. Self-Attested documents/ details to be submitted by the Authorized Person 
11. Power of attorney/Board resolution/ Consent letter 
12. Supporting Documents for SC/ST Enterprise
data.checklist_info_d:
Address:
Industries Commissionerate (MSME Incentive),
4th Floor, Block No. 1, Udyog Bhavan, Sector 11, 
Gandhinagar-382010

For other addresses visit- https://msmec.gujarat.gov.in/districtindustrieslist

Contact Details: 079 23258386, 079 23258387, 079 23258381
